results.title: Pain (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David A. Tapper and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coping with Serious Illness”.
Meryl Streep hosts this film discussing with experts in the field of managing pain. Joan Robinson suffers from cancer. She has lived with unremitting chronic pain for months and years along with her husband Eric which clouded their work and personal lives. Joan and her doctors explored many kinds of medication with mixed results - sometimes they would work, others not so.

results.title: Relationships and stress (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David A. Tapper, Time-Life Video & Television and Tapper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coping with Serious Illness”.
One part of a series of six programs which looks at the major problems faced by Joan Robinson, who is dying of cancer. This episode shows ways of handling the changing relationships with family, friends and medical personnel. Experts talk to the viewer about how serious illness can materially change relationships and how people can cope with the emotions and strains that inevitably follow diagnosis of a serious illness. Narrated by Meryl Streep.

results.title: Doctors and patients
results.creator_credit: David A. Tapper and Time-Life Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coping with Serious Illness”.
This film is one of a series of six programs that address the major problems people face in coping with serious illness. The series is hosted by actress, Meryl Streep. This particular program examines the unique relationship that develops between a doctor and a dying patient and looks at the case of Joan Robinson, a woman dying of cancer. Cast also includes Meryl Streep.

results.title: Use and reuse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conserving Our Environment”
How does a living organism relate to its environment? Dean learns about the ecological systems of the earth as he observes the ecological system of a fishbowl. He discovers how humans relate to their environment - how we use it, destroy it and restore it.

group_siblings.title: The Pollution crisis
group_siblings.creator_credit: Richardson Films and Coronet Films

results.title: The Pollution crisis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conserving Our Environment”.
As population increases, waste products are discarded in such increasing quantities that they cannot be absorbed by the environment, and pollution reaches crisis proportions. Shows some of the ways we are polluting our land, sea and air, and offers various solutions for protecting our environment.

results.title: General principles
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Nicholas Cockram, South Australian Film Corporation and Slater Sound Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conditioning for Sport”.
Gives an insight into some of the specific exercises and conditioning techniques necessary for the athlete to achieve his best. Illustrates various sports with particular emphasis on track and field events.

results.title: Weight and circuit training (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Nicholas Cockram, Bruce Moir and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 3 of Series “Conditioning for Sport”
Describes many specific exercises and training and condition techniques necessary for those interested in weight training. Weight training is a proven method for athletes to develop strength, power and muscular endurance, so it differs from weight lifting which emphasises strength and firm body building.
